subject: Philosophy
title: Zeno's Paradoxes
description: Learn Zeno's Paradoxes in one minute.

hook.text: To cross a room, you first go halfway. Then half of the remaining half. Then half again. You never arrive.

buildup.text: Zeno of Elea devised paradoxes to prove that motion is impossible. Logically, they seem airtight.

discovery.text: In the Achilles paradox, a fast runner can never overtake a slow tortoise if the tortoise has a head start.

twist.text: We know motion is real. But for two thousand years, nobody could explain where Zeno's logic went wrong.

climax.text: Calculus eventually solved it: infinite series can have finite sums. The halves add up to a whole.

punchline.text: Infinity is weird. But you still get across the room.

quiz.question: How was Zeno's paradox eventually resolved?
options: Calculus showed that infinite series can converge to finite values
Motion was proven to be impossible
Time was proven to be infinite
